statements.name: PROC HPFSELECT
statements.description: The HPFSELECT procedure enables you to control the forecasting model selection process by defining lists of candidate forecasting models. Using model selection lists created by the HPFSELECT procedure, you can control which forecasting model or models SAS High-Performance Forecasting software uses to forecast particular time series.

arguments.name: INSELECTNAME=
arguments.description: Provides a selection list as input to the HPFSELECT procedure. The input selection list is specified as a three-level name.

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: Specifies a descriptive label for the model selection to be stored in the SAS catalog or directory.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: Names the model selection file to be stored in the SAS catalog or directory.

arguments.name: REPOSITORY=
arguments.description: Names the SAS catalog or directory to contain the model specification.

arguments.name: VALIDATE
arguments.description: Checks that model specifications exist in the model repository specified in the REPOSITORY= option.

statements.name: DELETE
statements.description: The DELETE statement is used to remove model specifications from a selection list. There can be any number of model specifications listed in a DELETE statement and any number of DELETE statements.

statements.name: DIAGNOSE
statements.description: The DIAGNOSE statement is used to specify diagnostic options. DIAGNOSE options are used by the HPFENGINE procedure to subset a model selection list according to certain properties of a time series.

arguments.name: IDMBASE=
arguments.description: Specifies the base value of the time series used to determine the demand series components for an intermittent demand model.

arguments.name: AUTO
arguments.description: The base value is automatically determined by the time series median, minimum, and maximum values and the INTERMITTENT= option value.

arguments.name: INTERMITTENT=
arguments.description: Specifies a number greater than one that is used to determine whether or not a time series is intermittent.

arguments.name: SEASONTEST=
arguments.description: Specifies the options related to the seasonality test.

statements.name: FORECASTOPTIONS
statements.description: The FORECASTOPTIONS statement is used to specify forecasting options.

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: Specifies the significance level to use in computing the confidence limits of the forecast. The value of ALPHA= must be between 0 and 1. The default is ALPHA=0.05, which produces 95% confidence intervals.

arguments.name: AUTO
arguments.description: The base value is automatically determined by the time series median, minimum, and maximum values and the INTERMITTENT= option value.

statements.name: SELECT
statements.description: The SELECT statement is used to specify model selection options.

arguments.name: CHOOSE=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of a model specification that will be chosen by the HPFENGINE procedure. By default, HPFENGINE will select the model with the best fit in terms of the statistic set by the CRITERION= option.

arguments.name: CRITERION=
arguments.description: Specifies the model selection criterion (statistic of fit) to be used to select from several candidate models. This option is often used in conjunction with the HOLDOUT= option. The default is CRITERION=RMSE.
arguments.help: CRITERION=SSE | MSE | RMSE | UMSE | URMSE | MAXPE | MINPE | MPE | MAPE | MDAPE | GMAPE | MINPPE | MAXPPE | MPPE | MAPPE | MDAPPE | GMAPPE | MINSPE | MAXSPE | MSPE | SMAPE | MDASPE | GMASPE | MINRE | MAXRE | MRE | MRAE | MDRAE | GMRAE | MAXERR | MINERR | ME | MAE | MASE | RSQUARE | ADJRSQ | AADJRSQ | RWRSQ | AIC | AICC | SBC | APC | MAPES | MDAPES | GMAPES*option*

arguments.name: MAPPE
arguments.description: Symmetric mean absolute predictive percent error

arguments.name: GMAPPE
arguments.description: Geometric mean absolute predictive percent error

arguments.name: GMASPE
arguments.description: Geometric mean absolute symmetric percent error

arguments.name: MAPES
arguments.description: Mean absolute error percent of standard deviation

arguments.name: MDAPES
arguments.description: Median absolute error percent of standard deviation

arguments.name: GMAPES
arguments.description: Geometric mean absolute error percent of standard deviation

arguments.name: HOLDOUT=
arguments.description: Specifies the size of the holdout sample to be used for model selection. The holdout sample is a subset of actual time series that ends at the last nonmissing observation. The default is zero (no holdout sample).

arguments.name: HOLDOUTPCT=
arguments.description: Specifies the size of the holdout sample as a percentage of the length of the time series.

statements.name: SPECIFICATION
statements.description: The SPECIFICATION statement is used to list model specifications. There can be any number of models specifications in the list and any number of SPECIFICATION statements.

arguments.name: EVENTMAP
arguments.description: Syntax: EVENTMAP ( symbol= _NONE_ EVENT= eventDef <NODIFF> ) EVENTMAP ( symbol= string EVENT= eventDef ) Associates events with a model specification.

arguments.name: EXMFUNC
arguments.description: Associates an external model specification with a user-defined subroutine.

arguments.name: EXMMAP
arguments.description: Associates an external model specification with variable names in a DATA= data set, thus identifying the source of forecasts and optionally prediction standard errors, and the lower and upper confidence limits.

arguments.name: INPUTMAP
arguments.description: Associates the symbols in a model specification with variable names in a DATA= data set.

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: Overrides the label in the model specification and causes the new label to print in the model selection list in the HPFENGINE procedure. This option is useful if you have the same model specification listed more than once and want to distinguish between them in the HPFENGINE procedure output.

arguments.name: LOWER=
arguments.description: Identifies the variable to supply the lower confidence limit.

arguments.name: PREDICT=
arguments.description: Identifies the variable to supply forecasts and is required.

arguments.name: STDERR=
arguments.description: Identifies the variable to supply the prediction standard error.

arguments.name: UPPER=
arguments.description: Identifies the variable to supply the upper confidence limit.
